Title: Man jailed for nine years for theft, issuing dud cheques.
Summary: Obinna Kingsley Anijiofor was convicted and sentenced to nine years' imprisonment . Lagos State High Court in Ikeja, Lagos, has convicted him of theft, issuing dud cheques .

Title: FG clarifies position on capital gains tax amid pressure
Summary: Chairman of the Presidential Fiscal Policy and Tax Reforms Committee, Mr. Taiwo Oyedele, has clarified that the new CGT framework will not be changed . The new framework is the result of an upward review of the Capital Gains Tax (CGT)

Title: Reps probe oil firms’ failure to fund host communities trust
Summary: Reps probe oil firms’ failure to fund host communities trust . The House of Representatives has ordered a full-scale investigation into the failure of oil and gas companies to remit the mandatory three per cent of their annual operating expenditure to the Host Communities Development Trust Fund .

Title: Adebayo rallies northern elders on Nigeria’s future
Summary: Prince Adewole Adebayo urged Northern leaders to use their moral influence and institutional soft power to rebuild Nigeria’s unity and restore purposeful governance . Adebyo made the call during a meeting with the SDP presidential candidate .

Title: MOWAA land title not revoked by Edo govt, says German Ambassador
Summary: MOWAA land title not revoked by Edo govt, says German Ambassador to Nigeria . Annett Günther said the Edo State government has not revoked the Right of Occupancy granted to MowAA .

Title: 2027: Uzodinma urges media to champion electoral integrity
Summary: Imo governor urges media to champion electoral integrity ahead of 2027 general elections . Uzodinma calls on editors to be catalysts of democracy, national cohesion, and electoral integrity .

Title: Senators clash over INEC’s delineation exercise in Warri
Summary: Senators clash over delineation exercise in Warri Federal Constituency, Delta State . Senate resolved to investigate the ongoing delineation . exercise conducted by the Independent National Electoral Commission .

Title: ‘Tuberculosis kills 1.23m’
Summary:
Tuberculosis remains the world's leading infectious killer, claiming an estimated 1.23 million lives last year
The post ‘Tuberculosis kills 1.23m’ appeared first on Vanguard News.

Title: Group calls for restructuring or referendum to address Nigeria’s ‘fundamental incompatibility’
Summary: Group calls for restructuring or referendum to address Nigeria’s ‘fundamental incompatibility’ Ekwenche Research Institute has called for the urgent restructuring of Nigeria or the conduct of a referendum .

Title: Troops neutralise bandit, recover arms cache in Benue raid
Summary: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) have intensified their offensive against criminal gangs across Benue, Taraba, and Nasarawa States . They neutralised one bandit and recovered a cache of weapons during a raid on Mbagen community, Ukum Local Government Area of Benue State .
